key_points: Erin Andrews expressed enjoyment watching Tom Brady celebrate during the Tampa Bay Buccaneers Super Bowl victory boat parade.
The celebration took place on the water in Tampa, featuring players on various watercraft, as a COVID-19 pandemic precaution.
Tom Brady, along with his kids and teammate Rob Gronkowski, participated in the unique celebratory parade.
Brady tossed the Lombardi Trophy from one boat to another, a moment he discussed on The Late Late Show with James Corden.
The Lombardi Trophy was successfully caught by Brady's teammate, Cameron Brate.
During his late-night show appearance, Brady also commented on being helped to walk after the parade, attributing it to 'sea legs' or 'a touch of tequila.'
Gronkowski defended Brady's actions during the parade on the 10 Questions with Kyle Brandt podcast, stating it was an appropriate Super Bowl celebration.
Andy Cohen and James Corden both engaged with the participants on their respective shows, discussing the parade and celebrations.
Brady compared the incident with the Lombardi Trophy to making a 'fun' decision without much thought.
The event was notable for its deviation from traditional Super Bowl winners' parade due to pandemic precautions.
